docs.lead_paragraph: FINK--Daniel J., M.D. NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital and Columbia University Medical Center mourn the sudden passing of our dear friend and colleague Dr. Daniel J. Fink. A uniquely talented pathologist, Dr. Fink gave 28 years of devoted service to the Medical Center, the entirety of his professional career. He was founding director of the Hospital's Core Laboratory and the University's Center for Advanced Laboratory Medicine, and he led development of our first laboratory information system. An early and enthusiastic advocate for the use of information technology to improve quality and safety for patients, he also helped lead an influential NIH-funded study of the effects of the Chernobyl accident on thyroid cancer and other thyroid diseases. Dr. Fink received degrees from two of our schools--an M.D. degree from The College of Physicians & Surgeons and a master of public health degree from the Mailman School of Public Health. Our deepest condolences are extended to his wife, Yvonne, and daughter, Leslie. A beloved member of the New York-Presbyterian and Columbia University family, he will be greatly missed. Herbert Pardes, M.D., President & CEO NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital Lee Goldman, M.D., Dean Columbia University Medical Center
